intro: Nephelium ophiodes, commonly known as the red mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The fruit is typically small, round, and has a thick, reddish-purple rind. The plant thrives in humid climates with well-drained soil and requires a warm, tropical environment. Its botanical features make it an important species in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
